questions.Name: Which benefit is MOST aligned with the guiding principle 'progress iteratively with feedback'?
questions.explaination: Correct: Service providers are able to respond more quickly to customer needs

Options.Name: Service providers are able to respond more quickly to customer needs
Bottlenecks in the service provider's workflow are identified
The complexities of the service provider's IT systems are identified
The service provider gains a better understanding of the customer experience

questions.Name: What is the purpose of the 'incident management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation asquickly as possible

Options.Name: To minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation asquickly as possible
To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
To reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents
To support the agreed service quality by effective handling of all agreed user-initiated service requests

questions.Name: Why should some service requests be fulfilled with no additional approvals?

Options.Name: To ensure that spending is properly accounted for
To ensure that information security requirements are met
To set user expectations for fulfilment times

questions.Name: What impact does automation have on a service desk?
questions.explaination: Correct: Less low level work and a greater ability to focus on user experience

Options.Name: Less low level work and a greater ability to focus on user experience
Increased phone contact and a reduced ability to focus on user experience
Ability to work from multiple locations, geographically dispersed
Ability to work from a single centralised location

questions.Name: Which practice establishes a channel between the service provider and its users?
A service offering may include goods, access to resources, and service actions. Which is an example of a service action?
questions.explaination: Correct: A service desk agent provides support to a user

Options.Name: A mobile phone enables a user to work remotely
A password allows a user connect to a WiFi network
A license allows a user to install a software product
A service desk agent provides support to a user

questions.Name: Which costs are included in the value proposition of a service?
questions.explaination: Correct: Money that the service consumer no longer needs to spend because they are using the service

Options.Name: Additional expense that the service consumer has because they are using the service
Money that the service consumer no longer needs to spend because they are using the service
Tangible or intangible results for the service consumer because they are using the service
The benefits, usefulness, and importance of the service that are perceived by the service consumer

questions.Name: Which practice provides a communications point for users to report operational issues, queries and requests?
Which BEST describes the purpose of the 'improve' value chain activity?
questions.explaination: Correct: To continually improve all products and services across all value chain activities

Options.Name: To organize a major improvement initiative into several smaller initiatives
To make new and improved services and features available for use
To ensure a shared understanding of the vision and improvement direction for all products and services
To continually improve all products and services across all value chain activities

questions.Name:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence. 
A service is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating [?] that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks.
Which phase of problem management includes analysing incidents to look for patterns and trends?
What is the PRIMARY use of a change schedule?
questions.explaination: Correct: To plan changes and help avoid conflicts

Options.Name: To support the 'incident management' practice and improvement planning
To plan changes and help avoid conflicts

questions.Name: What includes governance as a component?
What is the purpose of the 'monitoring and event management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: To systematically observe services and service components

Options.Name: To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
To manage workarounds and known errors
To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
To systematically observe services and service components

questions.Name: What is used to link activities within the service value chain?
Which describes a 'change authority'?
questions.explaination: Correct: A person who approves a change

Options.Name: A model used to determine who will assess a change
A person who approves a change
A tool used to help plan changes
A way to manage the people aspects of change

questions.Name:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence. 
A [?] is the addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services.

Which TWO statements about the guiding principles are CORRECT?
  1. The guiding principles support continual improvement
  2. Each guiding principle applies to a selection of the available stakeholder groups
  3. Organizations should decide which one of the guiding principles is relevant to them
  4. Organizations should consider how the guiding principles interact with each other
Which activity is part of the 'continual improvement' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: Prioritizing and creating business cases for improvement initiatives

Options.Name: Handling compliments and complaints from users to identify improvements
Improving relationships with and between stakeholders
Prioritizing and creating business cases for improvement initiatives
Identifying the cause of unplanned interruptions to service

questions.Name: What is the definition of a problem?
questions.explaination: Correct: A cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents

Options.Name: An unplanned interruption to a service, or reduction in the quality of a service
A cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents
An incident for which a full resolution is not yet available
Any change of state that has significance for the management of a configuration item (CI)

questions.Name: Which dimension is MOST concerned with skills, competencies, roles and responsibilities?
What is a set of specialized organizational capabilities for enabling value for customers in the form of services?
Which ITIL practice recommends performing service reviews to ensure that services continue to meet the needs of the organization?
An organization asks a stakeholder to review a planned change. Which guiding principle does this demonstrate?
Which guiding principle considers which parts of an existing process should be kept by identifying how they contribute to value creation?
Which is a purpose of release management?
questions.explaination: Correct: To make new and changed services available for use

Options.Name: To make new and changed services available for use
To move hardware and software to live environments

questions.Name: Which step of the continual improvement model includes baseline assessments?

Options.Name: Where do we want to be?

questions.Name: Which practice has a purpose that includes managing risks to confidentiality, integrity and availability?
Which guiding principle considers customer and user experience?
Which statement about the 'optimize and automate' guiding principle is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Automation frees human resources for more complex activities

Options.Name: Activities should be automated before they are optimized
Automation is best applied to non-standard tasks
Technology eliminates the need for human intervention
Automation frees human resources for more complex activities

questions.Name: Which practice improves customer and user satisfaction by reducing the negative impact of service interruptions?
What aspect of 'service level management' asks service consumers what their work involves and how technology helps them?
Which describes a CORRECT approach to change authorization?
questions.explaination: Correct: Normal changes should be assessed and authorized before they are deployed

Options.Name: Changes included in the change schedule are pre-authorized and do not need additional authorization
Normal changes should be assessed and authorized before they are deployed
Emergency changes should be authorized by as many people as possible to reduce risk
Normal changes are typically implemented as service requests and authorized by the service desk

questions.Name: What varies in size and complexity, and uses functions to achieve its objectives?
Which directly assists with the diagnosis and resolution of simple incidents?
Which practice includes management of workarounds and known errors?
Which practice includes conducting regular reviews to ensure that services are still appropriate and relevant?
Which type of change is MOST LIKELY to be initiated as part of the 'service request management' practice?
Which of the four dimensions includes the knowledge bases needed to deliver and manage services?
Which statement about the 'continual improvement model' is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: The flow of the model helps organizations to link improvements to its goals

Options.Name: Organizations should work through the steps of the model in the sequence in which they are presented
The flow of the model helps organizations to link improvements to its goals
The model is applicable to only certain parts of the service value system
Organizations should use an additional model or method to link improvements to customer value
